content.user_title: Manage Plans.md Tasks with Status Tracking
content.value_statement: Keep your project tasks organized and track progress systematically. This skill helps you manage task lifecycles in Plans.md files with consistent formatting and status markers.
actual_capabilities: Adds new tasks to Plans.md with proper formatting and markers
Updates task status across lifecycle (TODO, WIP, ÂÆå‰∫Ü, Á¢∫Ë™çÊ∏à)
Maintains consistent Plans.md structure with task sections
Archives completed tasks automatically after 7 days
Supports Japanese and English task descriptions
Tracks subtasks and blocked tasks with reasons
limitations: Only works with Plans.md files in the project root
Requires specific marker format with backticks
Cannot modify files other than Plans.md
Task status changes follow predefined workflow rules

use_cases.title: Monitor task progress

best_practices: Update task status immediately when starting or completing work
Include relevant file paths and details in task descriptions
Use consistent marker format with backticks around status codes
anti_patterns: Leaving tasks in WIP status when not actively working on them
Creating tasks without proper status markers for tracking
Deleting completed tasks instead of archiving them

faq.question: What files can this skill modify?
faq.answer: This skill only works with Plans.md files in the project root directory.

faq.question: What status markers are supported?
faq.answer: cc:TODO, cc:WIP, cc:ÂÆå‰∫Ü, pm:‰æùÈ†º‰∏≠, pm:Á¢∫Ë™çÊ∏à, and blocked for stalled tasks.

faq.question: How does task archiving work?
faq.answer: Tasks marked complete are moved to the archive section after 7 days automatically.

faq.question: Can I track subtasks?
faq.answer: Yes, nested task lists under main tasks allow tracking of subtask completion status.

faq.question: What marker format is required?
faq.answer: Status markers must be enclosed in backticks like `cc:WIP` with no extra spaces.

faq.question: Can I use this with other tools?
faq.answer: Works with plain markdown files so it is tool-agnostic but requires manual integration.
